channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Prices Are Going Up Across Sectors
item.description: Food: A UN food price index soared 40% in May, the largest jump in a decade.  Consumer goods: Prices across 36 mostly wealthy countries rose at their fastest pace in more than 12 years during April.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 4
item.description: (The Atlantic)  Read: America has a drinking problem. This warning, plus its plan to sell more than 11 million shares, resulted in an 18% drop for the day.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Twitter Launches First Paid Subscription Service, Blue
item.description: At long last, Twitter has released its first subscription product, Twitter Blue. A virtual tip jar"Super Follows" for individual users to charge subscriptionsVoice-based DMs and tweets Features that limit the spread of misinformation and prevent harassmentStories (aka "Fleets")Spaces, a Clubhouse competitor
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: United Airlines Cuts Deal for Supersonic Commercial Jets
item.description: The promise of supersonic commercial flight reemerged yesterday when United Airlines announced it's buying 15 jets from Boom Supersonic.  Now, Boom and other supersonic startups are working on net-zero emissions and noise-muffling tech. Supersonic = faster than the speed of sound.  Looking ahead...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: California Drought Could Cause Wide-Ranging Industry Problems
item.description: The state of play: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has put 41 counties under a state of emergency in an attempt to drastically limit water use. Some scientists say the region is facing the worst drought in centuries. Officials are predicting the water level of Lake Oroville, the Beyoncé of California lakes, to hit a record low in August. California accounts for 80% of the US' almond supply, but because of shrinking water allocations, some farmers are simply bulldozing those notoriously thirsty almond trees. Anyone who dislikes wildfires.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: United Airlines Cuts Deal for Supersonic Commercial Jets
item.description: Supersonic commercial flight reemerged yesterday when United Airlines announced it's buying 15 jets from Boom Supersonic.  Now, Boom and other supersonic startups are working on net-zero emissions and noise-muffling tech.  Looking ahead... Cicadas aren't the only thing that return every ~17 years.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.description: The state of play: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has put 41 counties under a state of emergency in an attempt to drastically limit water use. Some scientists say the region is facing the worst drought in centuries. Officials are predicting the water level of Lake Oroville, the Beyoncé of California lakes, to hit a record low in August. California accounts for 80% of the US' almond supply, but because of shrinking water allocations, some farmers are simply bulldozing those notoriously thirsty almond trees. Anyone who dislikes wildfires.

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: June 4
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Amazon Gets Rid of Marijuana in Drug Screenings, Says ‘Legalize It’
item.description: Other employers like Hospitality Ventures, a management group that runs Marriott and Hilton hotels, have also dropped marijuana testing to attract already hard-to-find staff. So unless your position is regulated by the Department of Transportation, Amazon said it will treat marijuana like alcohol (should make for an interesting office holiday party).
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Etsy Announces Plans To Acquire Depop
item.description: Depop’s sales grew faster last year than its fashion resale rivals, Poshmark and ThredUp. More than $650 million worth of goods traded hands on Depop in 2020.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: AMC, Gaining Nearly 100% in a Day, Embraces Its Life as a Meme Stock
item.description: Through the program, individual investors will get benefits like a free large popcorn and invitations to special screenings. given AMC’s success in leveraging its internet fame for tangible business improvements, other meme stocks might follow its lead. An Elon Musk tweet about the viral song “Baby Shark” sent shares of Samsung Publishing, a company that owns a big stake in the song’s producer, up more than 10%. We thought meme stocks peaked with the bankrupt Hertz last summer, or GameStop this winter, but just this week...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 3
item.description: (CBC)  Listen: A Death in Cryptoland is a podcast that tells the story of the bizarre circumstances around the reported death of Canada’s largest crypto exchange.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Chemical-Filled Cargo Ship Sinks Off the Coast of Sri Lanka
item.description: the company that owns the ship said it was aware of the acid leak that caused the fire but was denied by two countries to offload the leaking container, and a Sri Lanka court ordered the ship’s captain and engineers to remain in the country as officials conduct a criminal investigation.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Amazon Gets Rid of Marijuana in Drug Screenings, Says ‘Legalize It’
item.description: So unless your position is regulated by the Department of Transportation, Amazon said it will treat marijuana like alcohol (should make for an interesting office holiday party). It also wants to stave off future unionization efforts at its warehouses.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Etsy Announces Plans To Acquire Depop
item.description: Depop’s sales grew faster last year than its fashion resale rivals, Poshmark and ThredUp. More than $650 million worth of goods traded hands on Depop in 2020.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Brew Mini: Morning Juice
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Ally Bank Becomes The First Large Bank To End Overdraft Fees
item.description: Other banks aren’t on boardCalls for an end to overdraft fees have been getting louder, and the most vocal critic is Sen. Elizabeth Warren.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: AMC, Gaining Nearly 100% in a Day, Embraces Its Life as a Meme Stock

An Elon Musk tweet about the viral song “Baby Shark” sent shares of Samsung Publishing, a company that owns a big stake in the song’s producer, up more than 10%. We thought meme stocks peaked with the bankrupt Hertz last summer, or GameStop this winter, but just this week...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: London's See-Through Sky Pool Opens
item.description: Don't worry, it also has technology that "allows it to move in high winds." Windy out?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 2
item.description: (New Yorker)   Read: A profile of the Pied Piper of SPACs, Chamath Palihapitiya. He also unveiled new initiatives aimed at narrowing the racial wealth gap.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Oil Prices Surge to Highest Levels Since Covid Began
item.description: At one point the price of oil plunged into negative territory—meaning someone would pay you to take possession of their oil barrel.  What happened: The powerful oil cartel OPEC and its allies agreed to gradually increase oil production. Yesterday, oil prices hit their highest levels since the pandemic began.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Krispy Kreme Files To Go Public
item.description: But after being battered and fried, Krispy Kreme was picked up by European investment firm JAB Holdings and glazed back to glory.  Did you know: Krispy Kreme owns Insomnia Cookies, which conducts over half of its sales via e-commerce.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: AMC Raises Millions To Acquire Other Theaters
item.description: AMC issued 8.5 million shares to investment firm Mudrick Capital to raise the sum. Did AMC find a $230 million bill in the laundry or…?
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Hack Shuts Down JBS Meat Processing Operations
item.description: JBS, the world's largest meat processor, had to shut down North American and Australian operations Monday following a coordinated ransomware attack.   The JBS incident comes just weeks after hackers forced the shutdown of the Colonial Pipeline and disrupted gas supplies up the East Coast.  If operations had remain paused for days or weeks, the hiccup could've turned into a real headache for JBS customers like supermarkets and fast-food chains that require a continuous supply of meat.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: London's See-Through Sky Pool Opens
item.description: Don't worry, it also has technology that "allows it to move in high winds." Windy out?

item.title: Hack Shuts Down JBS Meat Processing Operations
item.description: If operations do remain on pause for more than a few days, the hiccup could turn into a real headache for JBS customers like supermarkets and fast food chains that require a continuous supply of meat. The JBS incident comes just weeks after hackers forced the shutdown of the Colonial Pipeline and disrupted gas supplies up the East Coast.  Extra bad timingWhile wholesale meat prices remained mostly stable yesterday, extended disruption from the cyberattack could send meat prices—already on the rise—soaring even higher.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Oil Prices Surge to Highest Levels Since Covid Began
item.description: At one point the price of oil plunged into negative territory—meaning someone would pay you to take possession of their oil barrel.  What happened: The powerful oil cartel OPEC and its allies agreed to gradually increase oil production. Yesterday, oil prices hit their highest levels since the pandemic began.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Stock Analysis 101
item.description: You can find company financials through the SEC EDGAR portal. If the same company is trading at $20 per share, the PE ratio is 20. It’s more about finding patterns in the stock price that investors can exploit. Here are some signs of a company with a blossoming future:Lasting edge in the market: You want to invest in a company that has some competitive advantage in its sector. It’s the same thing with picking stocks: You want to invest in companies that are part of a growing industry. It’s OK if you’re feeling this way, because there’s more to a stock price than the numbers. Vincent Glode, a finance professor at the University of Pennsylvania, told the Brew that looking beyond the numbers can help you feel more confident about the stock. You won’t find any analysis there, so head over to a site like Yahoo Finance to see what investors are thinking. Chat with a financial advisor about the most responsible way to fit stock trading into your portfolio. Then, move onto valuation ratios, which compare a company’s financial results to its price in the market. Do your own researchAt first, financial statements can look like they’re written in Klingon. Financial market experts agree that identifying stocks that’ll beat the overall market is hard. Review the numbersNo matter your approach, it’s a good idea to take a look at the company’s financials before investing. In general, you want a quick ratio higher than 1. They care less about the company’s intrinsic value and more about how the stock price will shift in the future. See what analysts—and even your friends—are saying about the company’s future in qualitative terms. Fundamental analysis involves determining the company’s intrinsic value from the bottom up, from examining historical financial statements to imagining the company’s future. Analysts often associate industries with specific ratios that best depict a company’s financials.  Put it all togetherThis is where investment analysts take their research, create a financial model, and forecast the company’s future financials before making a trading decision. That’s why you often see higher trading volume around earnings reports. Analysts from major financial institutions put out their predictions ahead of companies’ earnings announcements, and a company’s goal is for these metrics to meet or exceed analyst expectations. Much of what’s built into a company’s stock price is investors’ expectations of the future, from new product lines to shifting market conditions. Investment analysts have already crunched the numbers, so you can put away your TI-83. If the company’s market cap—or total value in the market—is $50 million and sales were $5 million for the last 12-month period, the PSR is 10. “Psychological views of companies can last a very long time.”
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: The Week Ahead: June 1
item.description: Infrastructure: This week will be pivotal for the big infrastructure proposal President Biden has laid out. It may be short, but it is packed. Facebook's F8 developer conference begins tomorrow.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: June 1
item.description: Roughly 20% of all gun buyers in the US last year were first-time owners, and now, 39% of American households own guns, up from 32% in 2016. (Morning Brew)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Nestlé Rethinks Health Strategy Following Leaked Report
item.description: Unfortunately for Nestlé's PR team...   An internal presentation reported by the FT found that 63% of Nestlé products don't meet a "recognized definition of health" (in this case, at least 3.5/5 stars on Australia's health rating system).
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Naomi Osaka, Highest-Earning Female Athlete in the World, Drops Out of French Open
item.description: Other athletes said they respected Osaka’s initial decision to avoid the press, but pointed out that answering questions in front of a hot mic is just part of the job. Tennis legend Billie Jean King said that professional athletes have a responsibility to talk to the media.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: China Adopts Three-Child Policy Rule to Boost Population
item.description: The US population grew at its slowest rate since the Great Depression from 2010–2020, and its birth rate declined for the sixth straight year last year.  Why it matters: Declining population growth has profound implications for a country's economic success.     Zoom out: While many parts of the world face stagnant population growth, others are making up for it. Bottom line: As much as the Chinese government wants to grow the country's share of the world population, it might be fighting a losing battle.
item.author: Neal Freyman
